question: Question1
question_paragraph: Match the following WINDOWS system calls and UNIX system calls with reference to process control and File manipulation.

question: Question2
question_paragraph:
The Unix Operating System Kernel maintains two key data structures related to processes, the process table and the user structure. Now, consider the following two statements :
I. The process table is resident all the time and contain information needed for all processes, even those that are not currently in memory.
II. The user structure is swapped or paged out when its associated process is not in memory, in order not to waste memory on information that is not needed.
Which of the following options is correct with reference to above statements ?

question: Question3
question_paragraph: In UNIX, processes that have finished execution but have not yet had their status collected are known as _________.

question: Question4
question_paragraph: What is the function of following UNIX command ?WC – l &lta  &gtb&
options: It runs the word count program to count the number of lines in its input, a, writing the result to b, as a foreground process.
It runs the word count program to count the number of lines in its input, a, writing the result to b, but does it in the background.
It counts the errors during the execution of a process, a, and puts the result in process b.
It copies the ‘l’ numbers of lines of program from file, a, and stores in file b.
correct_answer: It runs the word count program to count the number of lines in its input, a, writing the result to b, but does it in the background.

question_paragraph: In Unix, the login prompt can be changed by changing the contents of the file __________.

question: Question7
question_paragraph:
What will be the output of the following Unix command ?
	$rm chap0\\[1 - 3\\]

question: Question8
question_paragraph:
Match the following for unix system calls :
List - I       List - II
(a) exec                   (i) Creates a new process
(b) brk                    (ii) Invokes another program overlaying memory space with a copy of an executable file
(c) wait                   (iii) To increase or decrease the size of data region
(d) fork                   (iv) A process synchronizes with termination of child process
Codes :
     (a) (b) (c) (d)
(1) (ii) (iii) (iv) (i)
(2) (iii) (ii) (iv) (i)
(3) (iv) (iii) (ii) (i)
(4) (iv) (iii) (i) (ii)

question: Question9
question_paragraph: The unix command: $ vi file1 file2
options: Edits file1 and stores the contents of file1 in file2
Both files i.e. file1 and file2 can be edited using 'ex' command to travel between the files
Both files can be edited using 'mv' command to move between the files
Edits file1 first, saves it and then edits file2
correct_answer: Both files i.e. file1 and file2 can be edited using 'ex' command to travel between the files

question: Question10
question_paragraph: The difference between a named pipe and a regular file in Unix is that
options: Unlike a regular file, named pipe is a special file
The data in a pipe is transient, unlike the content of a regular file
Pipes forbid random accessing, while regular files do allow this.
correct_answer: Pipes forbid random accessing, while regular files do allow this.

question: Question11
question_paragraph: Which UNIX/Linux command is used to make all files and sub-directories in the directory “progs” executable by all users ?

question: Question12
question_paragraph: Which statement is not correct about “init” process in Unix?
options: It is generally the parent of the login shell.
It is the first process in the system.
Init forks and execs a ‘getty’ process at every port connected to a terminal.
correct_answer: It is the first process in the system.

question: Question13
question_paragraph:
What does the following command do? 
grep -vn “abc” x
options: It will print all of the lines in the file x that match the search string “abc”.
It will print all of the lines in file x that do not match the search string “abc”.
It will print the total number of lines in the file x that match the string “abc”.
It will print the specific line numbers of the file x in which there is a match for string “abc”.
correct_answer: It will print all of the lines in file x that do not match the search string “abc”.

II. mv x, y

question: Question20
question_paragraph: The linux command “mknod myfifo b 4 16”
options: Will create a character device if the user is root
Will create a named pipe FIFO if the user is root
Will create a block device if the user is root
correct_answer: Will create a block device if the user is root

question: Question21
question_paragraph: Unix command to change the case of first three lines of file “shortlist” from lower to upper

question: Question22
question_paragraph: Which of the following information about the UNIX file system is not correct?
options: Super block contains the number of i-nodes, the number of disk blocks, and the start of the list of free disk blocks.
An i-node contains accounting information as well as enough information to locate all the disk blocks that holds the file’s data.
All the files and directories are stored in data blocks.

question: Question23
question_paragraph:
In Unix, files can be protected by assigning each one a 9-bit mode called rights bits. Now, consider the following two statements:
I. A mode of 641 (octal) means that the owner can read and write the file, other members of the owner’s group can read it, and users can execute only.
II. A mode of 100 (octal) allows the owner to execute the file, but prohibits all other access.
Which of the following options is correct with reference to above statements ?
options: Both I and II are correct.
Both I and II are incorrect.
correct_answer: Both I and II are correct.

question: Question24
question_paragraph: Which of the following statement is not correct with reference to cron daemon in UNIX O.S. ?
options: The cron daemon is the standard tool for running commands on a pre-determined schedule.
It starts when the system boots and runs as long as the system is up.
Cron reads configuration files that contain list of command lines and the times at which they invoked.
Crontab for individual users are not stored.
correct_answer: Crontab for individual users are not stored.

question: Question25
question_paragraph: In Unix, the command to enable execution permission for file “mylife” by all is ____________.

question: Question26
question_paragraph:
A student wishes to create symbolic links in a computer system running Unix. Three text files named "file 1", "file 2" and "file 3" exist in her current working directory, and the student has read and write permissions for all three files. Assume that file 1 contains information about her hobbies, file 2 contains information about her friends and file 3 contains information about her courses. The student executes the following sequence of commands from her current working directoryln-s file1file2ln-s file2file3Which of the following types of information would be lost from her file system?
(I) Hobbies (II) Friends (III) Courses
